title: Add soil type filter to plant entries list

requirements.summary: Add a client-side soil type filter control to the main plant entries list and update the shown entries + count accordingly.
acceptanceCriteria: A soil type filter control is visible on the main entries list view (where "Your Seeds" and the grid of entry cards are shown).
The filter options are derived from the current set of loaded entriesâ€™ soilType values (unique, non-empty), plus an "All soil types" option.
Selecting a specific soil type updates the UI to show only entries whose soilType matches the selected value.
Selecting "All soil types" shows all entries again.
When the filter is active, the count text (e.g., "Tracking X seed entries") reflects the number of entries currently shown (post-filter).
If there are no entries, the existing empty state remains unchanged and no filter is shown (or it is disabled in a sensible way).
All user-facing text related to the filter is in English.

file_operations.description: Implement client-side soil type filtering using already-fetched entries: add local state for selected soil type, derive unique non-empty soilType options from loaded entries, render a filter control near the "Your Seeds" header (only when entries exist), filter the entries rendered in the grid, and update the tracking/count text to reflect the filtered list size. Use existing shadcn-ui primitives already used on the screen (e.g., Card/Button/typography styling conventions) to keep the UI consistent; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
